summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in loader-utils (CVE-2022-37601) with CVSS 9.8 severity due to prototype pollution in parseQuery function. Issue was automatically closed after vulnerability was removed from the dependency tree.
userImpact: Users are exposed to a critical prototype pollution vulnerability in a transitive dependency that could lead to remote code execution.
rootCause: Prototype pollution vulnerability in loader-utils parseQuery function allowing arbitrary property injection through the name variable.
proposedFix: Upgrade loader-utils to version 2.0.0 or remove istanbul-instrumenter-loader dependency that transitively depends on vulnerable loader-utils 1.4.0.
resolutionDetails: Vulnerable library was removed from the dependency tree or marked as ignored in Mend inventory, automatically resolving the issue.
keyQuote: Prototype pollution vulnerability in function parseQuery in parseQuery.js in webpack loader-utils 2.0.0 via the name variable
